intro: Sida arboae, commonly known as the tree sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Sida arboae is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
